means: 同样地，一样地
例如
作为，以…的身份
如同
像，像…一样
由于
同时，当…时
尽管
阿斯（古罗马重量单位，约373克）
ampere 安
[地名] [比利时] 阿斯
Academy of Science 科学院

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均含有"因为"之意。
means: as ：从属连词，语意较because, since弱，着重在主句，所表示的原因或理由是"附带的"。
because ：从属连词，语意强，着重直接的原因或理由，所引出的从句是全句的重心，用以回答why提出的问题。
for ：并列连词，语气较弱，所引出的句子一般放在后面，表示附带说明的理由或推断理由。
since ：语意比because弱，但比as强，一般用于表示"由于大家已知的事实"。
as ：从属连词，引出方式从句。
like ：是前置词，后面跟的是宾语。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均可表示"虽然，尽管"之意。
means: though和although在意义上几乎毫无区别，但文体上后者是较正式用词，语气比though强。此外，在习惯用法上这两个词仍有以下一些差异：1.though可引出倒装语序的让步状语从句，although 则不能。2.though可与even连用，although则不能；在as though结构中，只用though，不能用although。3.though可以置于从句末，而although则不能。4.引出省略句时，通常用though。
as ： 引出让步状语从句只用于倒装语序结构中，语气强于上述两个连词。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均可表示"当……时"引出时间从句。
means: when ： 所引导的从句，其谓语动词既可是持续动词，也可是短暂动词；谓语动词动作发生的时间可以与主句谓语动词的动作是同时，或之前、之后。
while ： 句中的谓语动词应为持续动词，不用短暂动词，谓语动作发生的时间通常与主句谓语动词动作发生时间是同时。
as ： 侧重指从句与主句的动作同时进行，谓语动词可以是持续性的，可以是短暂性动词。

jx.jx_en_mean: at the time when (used to refer to an uncertain future event)

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly Brit.)used to indicate the time or date from which something starts
jx.jx_cn_mean: (主 英)[用于指某事开始之时或开始的日期] 从

lj.lj_ly: as from 1 January, a free market will be created.

lj.lj_ly: I'm on the dole as from now.
lj.lj_ls: 从现在开始我就要吃救济了。

lj.lj_ly: You know how pools winners always say it won't change their lives? Yeah, as if.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : reduced form of Old English  alswā 'similarly' (see also)

entry.tran: （表示两件事情同时发生）当…的时候，在…的同时
entry.def: If something happens as something else happens, it happens at the same time.

example.ex: Another policeman has been injured as fighting continued this morning...
example.tran: 今早又有一名警员在冲突中受伤。

example.ex: All the jury's eyes were on him as he continued...
example.tran: 在他继续陈述的时候，全体陪审员的目光都集中在他身上。

entry.def: You use the structure as...as when you are comparing things.

example.ex: I never went through a final exam that was as difficult as that one...
example.tran: 我从来没有碰到过像那次那么难的期末考试。

example.ex: There was no obvious reason why this could not be as good a film as the original.
example.tran: 找不出明显的理由来解释为什么这部片子拍得不如原先的好。

entry.def: You use as...as to emphasize amounts of something.

example.ex: You can look forward to a significant cash return by saving from as little as £10 a month...
example.tran: 只要每个月存下区区10英镑，你就有希望得到相当可观的现金收益。

example.ex: She gets as many as eight thousand letters a month.
example.tran: 她一个月里收到的信件多达8,000封。

entry.def: You use as when you are indicating what someone or something is or is thought to be, or what function they have.

example.ex: He has worked as a diplomat in the US, Sudan and Saudi Arabia...
example.tran: 他曾任驻美国、苏丹和沙特阿拉伯的外交官。

example.ex: The news apparently came as a complete surprise...
example.tran: 这个消息显然让人大吃一惊。

entry.def: If you do something as a child or as a teenager, for example, you do it when you are a child or a teenager.

example.ex: She loved singing as a child and started vocal training at 12.
example.tran: 她从小就喜欢唱歌，12岁开始了声乐训练。

entry.def: You use as to say how something happens or is done, or to indicate that something happens or is done in the same way as something else.

example.ex: I'll behave toward them as I would like to be treated...
example.tran: 我会以希望别人对待我的方式来对待他们。

example.ex: Today, as usual, he was wearing a three-piece suit...
example.tran: 像往常一样，他今天穿的是三件套。

entry.def: You use as in expressions like as a result and as a consequence to indicate how two situations or events are related to each other.

example.ex: As a result of the growing fears about home security, more people are arranging for someone to stay in their home when they're away...
example.tran: 因为越来越担心住宅安全，更多的人在出门的时候会在家中留人。

example.ex: In this changing business environment, different demands are being placed on employees. As a consequence, the education system needs to change.
example.tran: 在当今变幻莫测的商业环境下，员工被提出各种不同的要求。因此，教育体系有必要随之改变。

entry.def: You use as to introduce short clauses which comment on the truth of what you are saying.

example.ex: As you can see, we're still working...
example.tran: 如你所见，我们仍在工作。

example.ex: We were sitting, as I remember, in a riverside restaurant.
example.tran: 我记得我们当时是坐在一个河畔的餐馆里。

entry.def: You can use as to mean 'because' when you are explaining the reason for something.

example.ex: They are regularly sent booklets about personal safety, but they barely read them as they have so much paperwork to deal with...
example.tran: 他们经常会收到关于人身安全问题的宣传册，但因为大量文案工作缠身，他们几乎无暇阅读。

example.ex: Enjoy the first hour of the day. This is important as it sets the mood for the rest of the day.
example.tran: 好好享受每天的第一个小时。这之所以重要是因为它会决定你一整天的心情。

entry.def: You say as it were in order to make what you are saying sound less definite.

example.ex: I'd understood the words, but I didn't, as it were, understand the question.
example.tran: 字面的意思我懂了，但是可以说我并不能理解这个问题。

entry.tran: 事实上，实际上（表示实际情况和可能情况的对比）
entry.def: You use expressions such as as it is ,as it turns out, and as things stand when you are making a contrast between a possible situation and what actually happened or is the case.

example.ex: I want to work at home on a Tuesday but as it turns out sometimes it's a Wednesday or a Thursday.
example.tran: 我想周二在家工作，但实际上有时却是周三或是周四。

collins.item: USED WITH OTHER PREPOSITIONS AND CONJUNCTIONS
collins.tran: 与其他介词或连词连用

entry.def: You use as for and as to at the beginning of a sentence in order to introduce a slightly different subject that is still connected to the previous one.

example.ex: I feel that there's a lot of pressure put on policemen. And as for putting guns in their hands, I don't think that's a very good idea at all.
example.tran: 我觉得给警员的压力太大了。至于让他们佩枪，我并不认为是一个明智之举。

entry.def: You use as to to indicate what something refers to.

example.ex: They should make decisions as to whether the student needs more help...
example.tran: 他们应该决定学生是否需要更多的帮助。

example.ex: Andy sat down at the table and inquired as to what the problem was.
example.tran: 安迪在桌边落座，询问出了什么问题。

entry.def: If you say that something will happen as of, or in British English as from, a particular date or time, you mean that it will happen from that time on.

example.ex: The border, effectively closed since 1981, will be opened as of January the 1st...
example.tran: 实质上从1981年就已关闭的边境将于1月1日开放。

example.ex: She is to retire as from 1 October.
example.tran: 她将于10月1日退休。

entry.def: You use as if and as though when you are giving a possible explanation for something or saying that something appears to be the case when it is not.

example.ex: Anne shrugged, as if she didn't know...
example.tran: 安妮耸了耸肩，好像她并不知晓。

example.ex: He burst into a high-pitched laugh, as though he'd said something funny.
example.tran: 他突然放声大笑，好像讲了什么好笑的事似的。

means.word_mean: 1. to the same degree (often followed by `as');

sentences.sentence: "birds were singing and the child sang as sweetly"
"he is every bit as mean as she is"

slang.tokens: sure as god made little green apples

example.en: It's sure as God made little green apples that they'll never get here.
example.zh: 这是毫无疑问的，他们绝对到不了这儿。

example.en: You sure as hell better get yourself over here.
example.zh: 你当然还是亲自过来好。

example.en: He'll sure as shit do it if you ask him.
example.zh: 如果你找他干，他肯定干。

example.en: He would be crazy as a loon to set fire to the house.
example.zh: 要放火烧房子，他大概是发疯了。

example.en: He's as mean as a louse with money matters.
example.zh: 他在金钱问题上吝啬到了极点。

sentences.en: She is as tall as her mother.
The dining room was twice as big as the Tom's.
sentences.cn: 这个餐厅比汤姆的餐厅大一倍。

sentences.en: This is as difficult a problem as you are likely to meet.
sentences.cn: 像这样的难题, 你可能会碰到。

sentences.en: As a schoolboy, he showed every sign of genius.
sentences.cn: 当他还是个小学生的时候, 就显示出了天资聪慧。

means.word_mean: (表示结果)成为, 看作, 看成

sentences.en: We had better treat it as a joke.
sentences.cn: 我们最好把它当作玩笑。

means.word_mean: (表示目的)为了, 以…为目的

sentences.en: The dykes were built as a protection against the sea.
sentences.cn: 建筑堤坝是为了防止海水泛滥。

means.word_mean: (表示举例)例如, 诸如…之类的

sentences.en: We talked about such subjects as the weather.
sentences.cn: 我们谈论了诸如天气之类的话题。

sentences.en: I was coming in as he was going out.
sentences.cn: 我进来的时候, 他正出去。

means.word_mean: 尽管, 即使, 虽然

sentences.en: Intelligent as you are, I suspect you will fail.
sentences.cn: 尽管你聪明, 我猜想你会失败。

sentences.en: As you weren't there I left a message.
sentences.cn: 因为你不在那里, 我留了个信儿。

jushi.english: Return as much money as you borrowed.
He is not as old as she,but older〔younger〕 than she.
jushi.chinese: 他并不是和她同样年纪，而是比她老〔年轻〕些。

jushi.english: You've made as many mistakes as I have.
jushi.chinese: 你犯的错误和我一样多。
